TopicTitle: I'm going to 3D print your spaceship and send it you

Articles.Content:
Last night I decided to 3d print a random redditor's KSP spaceship. I had such a great response that someone mentioned this forum and my mind has been since mesmerized by all the unique designs. If you have access to a printer, you can print it yourself here:

https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:223355

I'd like to print as many as possible so I'm running a short contest to print the highest voted craft here: reddit post

I'm hoping the vehicle voted is indicative of the quality shown in this forum!
This... is awesome....
Id like to see a Kerbal X. It's probably the most iconic Kerbal ship.
I feel compelled to create something and then "borrow" time on my school's 3D printer.

Print a Proton? See my sig.

Edited January 11, 2014 by inigma
OOOOOHHHHHHHHHHHH I WANT NAOW!!! how do you print your own is it a software or what?

OOOOOHHHHHHHHHHHH I WANT NAOW!!! how do you print your own is it a software or what?

I haven't been able to export the craft files so I've been modeling the spaceships individually in Solidworks.
Print the Munbug.
Ok. Details: which printer, what materials, and what detail of print did you use?

Up! Plus by PP3DP

ABS Plastic - Grey

0.2mm layer thickness, a mixture of shell and light infill depending on part.
You can import .mu files into blender with a plugin made by some user around here, forgot his name tho
I reckon you should do Munbug. For me it is the most iconic Kerbal ship.
Would love if you could a 3-d print of the Gradius Mk. VI. Check my forum posts to find it, or pm me and I'll send you a screen shot.
Awesome! Could you tell the price of the 3D-printer (well, if it isn't your secret )?
NOBODY tell Whackjob about this thread!

I reckon you should do Munbug. For me it is the most iconic Kerbal ship.

I thought the same thing. Then again, that would mean printing a copy of a Saturn-Apollo. That's iconic enough, sure, but not because of KSP exactly...

I'd have to go with the kerbal X if I have to be impartial. But if I can submit one of my own, that I would love to see printed... well, the ship that jumps to mind is mine, as you could have guessed ^^'

My most favorite SSTO ever, the White Dart (until the next one, I guess). And that's because you have already printed a lander, and kerbal X is a nice rocket everybody knows.

Rune. I guess you want variety, right?

If you want iconic.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VdMwN1pmQ74

I won't put in my personal favorite(yet)as I don't want to flood the thread.

Edited January 11, 2014 by Spartwo

If you could just print my favourite little plane, the p-50

Thread: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/60712-The-awesome-ant-powered-plane%21

o.0 FINALLY! A good... no, a GREAT reason/excuse to shell out on a 3D printer!!

First projects:

Kerbin anchorage:

Incom T-65 X-Wing fighter:

Ark II Space Bus:

BUT FIRST, THIS:

Ragnar Fuel Station. Do 3D printers do like, REALLY fine details, like spinaret thin?

(and yes, that puppy still has engines on it - and enough delta-V to take it on a practically target-direct Grand Tour. And back again Sure do love those Super Atomic engines...).

Edited January 12, 2014 by ihtoit
Second the motion to do something from Macey's series.
Print the Aeris 4A

Remember guys 3D printer have a limit. I made a read on Kerbal 3D prints and how it works:

Use welding mod Tomas your ship 1 part.

Get .mu of part

Turn into blender model

Customize in blender to make it good for printing

Print! On shapeways.com

I haven't been able to export the craft files so I've been modeling the spaceships individually in Solidworks.

The Squad needs to get on this. They could be the first gaming sim that allows you to 3D print your in-game creations. This alone could sell 500k copies of KSP. . .

Squad?

The Squad needs to get on this. They could be the first gaming sim that allows you to 3D print your in-game creations. This alone could sell 500k copies of KSP. . .

Squad?

Do it.Do it now!

i want to try this too, but my process will be to 3d print all differents parts and assemble them with integrated neodymium magnets, so almost anything is achievable! even rapid unplanned dissembly. i just need to figure how to get the in-game models with minimal post-treatment to print those parts. and it will become tricky to snap things like solar panels, and other thing that you put freely on your designs...
